attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.

I idolize a particular hero of my faith, and constantly refer to that person’s deeds and example.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Aspiration. I seek to prove myself worthy of my god’s favor by matching my actions against his or her teachings. (Any)

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I owe my life to the priest who took me in when my parents died.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: I judge others harshly, and myself even more severely.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVrQhoZSpygMcZqZnep_description
attribs.current:
In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action.
While raging, you gain the following benefits if you aren’t wearing heavy armor:
-You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
-When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a bonus to the damage roll that increases as you gain levels as a barbarian, as shown in the Rage Damage column of the Barbarian table.
-You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
If you are able to cast spells, you can’t cast them or concentrate on them while raging.
Your rage lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or if your turn ends and you haven’t attacked a hostile creature since your last turn or taken damage since then. You can also end your rage on your turn as a bonus action.
Once you have raged the number of times shown for your barbarian level in the Rages column of the Barbarian table, you must finish a long rest before you can rage again.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVrQhoasolbkwhRhkkz_description
attribs.current: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor⁠ Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVrQhoasolbkwhRhkl4_description
attribs.current: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVrQhoasolbkwhRhkl5_description
attribs.current: You know the poison spray cantrip. You can cast animal friendship an unlimited number of times with this trait, but you can target only snakes with it. Starting at 3rd level, you can also cast suggestion with this trait. Once you cast it, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVrQhoba6mZwWFWC8hC_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVrQhoba6mZwWFWC8hD_description
attribs.current: You are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVrQhocaIbaYOD8dRKQ_description
attribs.current:
As an acolyte, you command the respect of those who share your faith, and you can perform the religious ceremonies of your deity. You and your adventuring companions can expect to receive free healing and care at a temple, shrine, or other established presence of your faith, though you must provide any material components needed for spells. Those who share your religion will support you (but only you) at a modest lifestyle.
You might also have ties to a specific temple dedicated to your chosen deity or pantheon, and you have a residence there. This could be the temple where you used to serve, or a temple where you have found a new home. While near your temple, you can call upon the priests for assistance, provided the assistance you ask for is not hazardous and you remain in good standing with your temple.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhoe7Hqbzpi-Iz6D_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Slashing, Alternate Damage: 1d10, Alternate Damage Type: Slashing

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhoe7Hqbzpi-Iz6E_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Slashing, Range: 20/60,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhoe7Hqbzpi-Iz6F_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d6, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 30/120,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MVrQhof1kwWWjMUYU8y_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and project a puff of noxious gas from your palm. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d12 poison damage.

​⁠This spell’s damage increases by 1d12 when you reach 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-MVrQhof1kwWWjMUYU8y_spelltarget
attribs.current: A creature you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MVrQhogcIrz0LkOemVl_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional beast for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MVrQhogcIrz0LkOemVl_spelldescription
attribs.current: This spell lets you convince a beast that you mean it no harm. Choose a beast that you can see within range. It must see and hear you. If the beast’s Intelligence is 4 or higher, the spell fails. Otherwise, the beast must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the spell’s duration. If you or one of your companions harms the target, the spells ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-MVrQhogcIrz0LkOemVl_spelltarget
attribs.current: A beast that you can see within range

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhoiAv1lKxqnbRLE_itemcontent
attribs.current: A backpack can hold one cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhoiAv1lKxqnbRLG_itemcontent
attribs.current: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhoiAv1lKxqnbRLH_itemcontent
attribs.current: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch - or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel - takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhojdggvmjk9YO9i_itemcontent
attribs.current: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhojdggvmjk9YO9i_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Adventuring Gear, Damage: 1, Damage Type: Fire, Range: 20/40

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhojdggvmjk9YO9j_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhojdggvmjk9YO9k_itemcontent
attribs.current: A waterskin can hold up to 4 pints of liquid.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrQhojdggvmjk9YO9l_itemcontent
attribs.current: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-MVrRqia0yPxASXgTLvZ_description
attribs.current:
At 2nd level, you gain an uncanny sense of when things nearby aren’t as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge away from danger.
You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps and spells. To gain this benefit, you can’t be blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-MVrSKNZnTYtBl3sKfdw_itemcontent
attribs.current: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.
